content.question: A seafood-sales manager collected data on the maximum daily temperature, <math alttext="uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the daily revenue from salmon sales, <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, using sales receipts for 30 days selected at random. Using the data, the manager conducted a regression analysis and found the least-squares regression line to be <math alttext="R hat equals, 126 plus 2.37 times uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>126</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2.37</mn><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. A hypothesis test was conducted to investigate whether there is a linear relationship between maximum daily temperature and the daily revenue from salmon sales. The standard error for the slope of the regression line is <math alttext="S E sub b sub 1 equals 0.65" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Assuming the conditions for inference have been met, which of the following is closest to the value of the test statistic for the hypothesis test?

topic.text: 9.5: Carrying Out a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
